answers.answer: I have not had surgery and get a warm fluid feeling ... So weird.  I think you should call ns ... Better safe than sorry

So, if I understand u get the feeling, but it is not wet? It is possible it is just the nerve "waking" back up from being pinched or compressed...it can give that sensation.....and it very normal post op."selma"
no it is not a wet feeling. thanks selma! i will keep an eye on it just to make sure.
I do not mean feeling wet I mean actually wet...as long as it is not wet u should be ok.....
I had that for about 6 months post op and then it went away, there is so much healing going on, good luck with your recovery!

I had the same feeling for a few weeks so i went back to my ns. They squeezed the heck out of my head and scar. I was ok, just healing. But holy crap did all that playin with my head and scar hurt. Just keep an eye on it. Selma said it best.
my husband n i both have the same feeling occasionly,that something wet is on our backs,never nothing,we both are diabetics,2,maybe thats it

Hi  and  welcome  to the  Chiari forum,Yes  for  those  that do not  have Chiari  or recovering  from the decompression   surgery  it  may  be some other condition  that affects  the nerves....and  as  you  said  diabetes  is one  that  can cause  many  different  nerve  pains  and sensations...Do  check  out  one  of  the diabetes  forums....http://www.medhelp.org/forums/Diabetes-Prevention--Pre-Diabetes/show/1393

question: sorry i've been posting a lot. but one more thing...i think. (:when i had the surgery this time last week, my NS did the bone trimming, the dura patch, all that jazz, and he had to shrink my right tonsil.now after surgery i am always feeling this sensation of fluid or something like that (tingling, tickly, etc) running down the right side of my neck. is that normal?i've been having a family member look at the incision a few times a day to make sure it is looking normal, not swollen, red, infected or anything and they say it is looking good.
title: sensation
